Description: Two small amulets made of faience. The first shows a wedjat eye made of white faience. The base is slightly convex and the upper side is shown in relief, the perforation runs horizontally through the whole piece but is very thin. No glaze preserved. The second amulet consists of a flat plaque that had a lug at the top but is now broken off. The base is flat, the upper side shows a cobra-snake facing to the right side. Faint traces of turquoise glaze preserved.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
